TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit Utf8JsonReader extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides a high-performance API for forward-only, read-only access to the UTF-8 encoded JSON text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
`Utf8JsonReader` processes the text sequentially with no caching and by default adheres strictly to the [JSON RFC](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259).
When `Utf8JsonReader` encounters invalid JSON, it throws a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderException> with basic error information like line number and byte position on the line. Since this type is a ref struct, it doesn't directly support async. However, it does provide support for reentrancy to read incomplete data and to continue reading once more data is presented. To be able to set max depth while reading OR allow skipping comments, create an instance of <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState> and pass it to the reader.

MemberSignature.Value: public Utf8JsonReader (ref System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence<byte> jsonData, bool isFinalBlock, System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState state);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor([in]valuetype System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence`1<unsigned int8>& jsonData, bool isFinalBlock, valuetype System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState state) cil managed
Public Sub New (ByRef jsonData As ReadOnlySequence(Of Byte), isFinalBlock As Boolean, state As JsonReaderState)
public: Utf8JsonReader(System::Buffers::ReadOnlySequence<System::Byte> % jsonData, bool isFinalBlock, System::Text::Json::JsonReaderState state);

Docs.param: The UTF-8 encoded JSON text to process.
when the input sequence contains the entire data to process. only if it's known that the input span contains partial data with more data to follow.
If this is the first call to the constructor, pass in a default state. Otherwise, capture the state from the previous instance of the and pass that back.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type, and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it. This is the reason why the constructor accepts a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState>.

when the input span contains the entire data to process. only if it's known that the input span contains partial data with more data to follow.

A struct that contains the reader state. On the first call to the constructor, it should reflect a default state; otherwise, it should capture the state from the previous instance instance of the and pass that back.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type, and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it. This is the reason why the constructor accepts a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BytesConsumed As Long
public: property long BytesConsumed { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of bytes consumed by the so far for the current instance of the with the given UTF-8 encoded input text.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentDepth As Integer
public: property int CurrentDepth { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the depth of the current token.
Docs.value: The depth of the current token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `CurrentDepth` property tracks the recursive depth of the nested objects / arrays within the JSON text processed so far.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentState As JsonReaderState
public: property System::Text::Json::JsonReaderState CurrentState { System::Text::Json::JsonReaderState get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current snapshot of the state that must be captured by the caller and passed back in to the constructor with more data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Unlike the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader>, which is a ref struct, the state can survive across async/await boundaries, and hence this type is required to provide support for reading in more data asynchronously before continuing with a new instance of the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasValueSequence As Boolean
public: property bool HasValueSequence { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates which Value property to use to get the token value.
Docs.value: if should be used to get the token value. if should be used instead.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If `HasValueSequence` is `false`, <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSequence> is empty. Therefore, read the token value using the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan> property.
For input data within a `ReadOnlySpan<byte>`, this always returns `false`. For input data within a `ReadOnlySequence<byte>`, this only returns `true` if the token value straddles more than a single segment and hence can't be represented as a span.

public: property SequencePosition Position { SequencePosition get(); };

Docs.value: The current within the provided UTF-8 encoded input ReadOnlySequence<byte> or a default if the struct was constructed with a ReadOnlySpan<byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ValueSequence As ReadOnlySequence(Of Byte)

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the last processed token as a ReadOnlySpan<byte> slice of the input payload. If the JSON is provided within a ReadOnlySequence<byte> and the slice that represents the token value fits in a single segment, then contains the sliced value since it can be represented as a span. Otherwise, contains the token value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `false`, `ValueSequence` is empty. Therefore, only access `ValueSequence` if <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `true`. Otherwise, the token value must be accessed from <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ValueSpan As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte)
public: property ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> ValueSpan { ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the last processed token as a ReadOnlySpan<byte> slice of the input payload. If the JSON is provided within a ReadOnlySequence<byte> and the slice that represents the token value fits in a single segment, then contains the sliced value since it can be represented as a span. Otherwise, the contains the token value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `true`, <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan> is empty. Therefore, only access `ValueSpan` if <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `false`. Otherwise, the token value must be accessed from <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSequence>.
